title: Durant passes legend Chamberlain on all-time list
description: Kevin Durant moves past the great Wilt Chamberlain and into seventh on the NBA all-time scoring list during the Houston Rockets' defeat by the Portland Trail Blazers.
fullText:
Kevin Durant moved past the great Wilt Chamberlain on the NBA all-time scoring list but his 30 points could not guide the Houston Rockets to a win against the Portland Trail Blazers.

Durant, 37, has 31,435 points in his career and is now seventh on the all-time list. LeBron James of the Los Angeles Lakers leads the way with 42,601.

The Trail Blazers triumphed 111-105 at Moda Center in Portland.

Chamberlain, who died in 1999, is the only player to score 100 points in an NBA game and was a two-time champion with the Philadelphia 76ers and the Lakers.

In 1962 he averaged a record 50.4 points a game, and was the leading NBA scorer when he retired in 1973.

title: Manfred says MLB prepared to produce and distribute local broadcasts for FanDuel network teams
description: Major League Baseball is prepared to produce and distribute local broadcasts for teams whose telecasts are uncertain this season because of the financial problems of the FanDuel Sports Network regional networks.  Main Street Sports Group, which operates the FanDuel networks, did not make its December payment to the St. Louis Cardinals.  It also carries games of Atlanta, Cincinnati, Detroit, Kansas City, the Los Angeles Angels, Miami, Milwaukee and Tampa Bay along with 13 teams in the NBA and seven in the NHL.
fullText:
NEW YORK (AP) ‚Äî Major League Baseball is prepared to produce and distribute local broadcasts for teams whose telecasts are uncertain this season because of the financial problems of the FanDuel Sports Network regional networks.

Main Street Sports Group, which operates the FanDuel networks, did not make its December payment to the St. Louis Cardinals. It also carries games of Atlanta, Cincinnati, Detroit, Kansas City, the Los Angeles Angels, Miami, Milwaukee and Tampa Bay along with 13 teams in the NBA and seven in the NHL.

‚ÄúNo matter what what happens, whether it‚Äôs Main Street, a third party or MLB media, fans are going to have the games,‚Äù baseball Commissioner Rob Manfred said Thursday.

MLB took over broadcasts for San Diego in May 2023 after Diamond Sports Group missed a payment to the Padres and added Arizona that July.

Colorado joined MLB's distribution in 2024, and Cleveland and Minnesota in 2025. Seattle is being added this season and possibly Washington, which is leaving the Mid-Atlantic Sports Network.

Diamond was renamed Main Street Sports Group as it emerged out of Chapter 11 bankruptcy proceedings last year and its networks were rebranded as FanDuel.

‚ÄúOur focus, particularly given the point in the calendar, is to maximize the revenue that‚Äôs available to the clubs, whether that‚Äôs MLB Media or third party,‚Äù Manfred said. ‚ÄúThe clubs have control over the timing. They can make a decision to move to MLB Media because of the contractual status now. I think that what's happening right now clubs are evaluating their alternatives. Obviously they‚Äôve made significant payroll commitments already and they‚Äôre evaluating the alternatives to find the best revenue source for the year and the best outlet in terms of providing quality broadcasts to their fans.‚Äù

Manfred said local media provides more than 20% of industry revenue.

MLB and the players' association for 2024 allowed discretionary fund distributions of up to $15 million each to teams whose local media revenue had declined since 2022 or 2023, but they did not reach a similar agreement for 2025.

‚ÄúWe are not providing financial assistance right now,‚Äù Manfred said.

He spoke at a news conference to announce an initiative with Foster Love that envisions 250,000 volunteer hours to mark the 250th anniversary of the United States. At the news conference, MLB staff assembled duffel bags with goods for foster care children.

AP MLB: https://apnews.com/hub/MLB

title: Carson Beck family tree: Meet sister Kylie, ex-NBA cheerleader mom and more about Florida roots
description: Carson Beck's family isn't shy about showing their support for the Miami QB.
fullText:
Carson Beck family tree: Meet sister Kylie, ex-NBA cheerleader mom and more about Florida roots originally appeared on The Sporting News. Add The Sporting News as a Preferred Source by clicking here.

Does Carson Beck have a girlfriend?

Not many college quarterbacks can say they had a resume the caliber of Carson Beck's.

While both of his championships came as a backup when he played for the Georgia Bulldogs, Beck still cemented himself as a starter by 2023, when he¬†threw for 3,941 yards and had 28 total touchdowns for Georgia. Then, Beck decided to play one last year in college, transferring to the Miami Hurricanes for a reported hefty NIL package.

Those around Beck have been in the spotlight often, from his past relationship with Miami women's basketball star Hanna Cavinder, to his family, including his mom and sister.

Here's a full breakdown of Beck's family tree.

MORE: Why did Carson Beck transfer from Georgia to Miami?

Carson Beck's sister is Kylie Beck. She is a former cheerleader and member of the dance team at Georgia, where she attended at the same time as her brother.

When the quarterback departed Georgia for Miami, Kylie Beck, a sophomore at the time, also shared that she was leaving the Bulldogs behind. It hasn't been confirmed whether she also chose to attend Miami, but she's remained a close supporter of her brother with the Hurricanes.

‚ÄúThank you letter to Athens. When one door closes, another door always opens with something greater on the other side," Beck wrote, per The Athlete Lifestyle on SI.¬†"I entered this new city hoping for greatness, success and happiness. Although there are times there was an abundance of these things, there were also times when I was at the lowest I‚Äôve ever been and my family and I went through the hardest things we‚Äôve ever dealt with. To say this experience has been a whirlwind of emotions would be an understatement.

I am thankful that I‚Äôve been able to call Athens my home for the past five years, traveling to games to support my brother and then making my dream a reality this past year when i was awarded the opportunity to be both a Georgette & Dance Dawg. It was such a blessing being by my brothers side and cheering him on from the field."

Like Carson, Kylie is from Jacksonville, Florida, so the quarterback's transfer to Miami was closer to their home state.

Whether as a Georgia cheerleader or just as a fan, Kylie has been a very vocal supporter of her brother's football career. She's shared plenty of social media posts about Carson.

Kylie Beck has also become known for her gameday outfits.

Kylie Beck is not a cheerleader for the Dallas Cowboys. However, she was invited to dance with the Cowboys cheerleaders in March 2025, posing on the field afterward.

MORE: How does NIL money work in college football?

Carson Beck's mom is Tracy Beck. She grew up in Clinton, Md., went to Maryland for college and danced for the Washington Bullets (now the Wizards) in the past, per The Athletic. Tracy Beck is a kindergarten teacher¬†at Alimacani Elementary School in Jacksonville, Florida, where her kids were raised.

Like the rest of Carson's family, Tracy has been a very public supporter of the quarterback's career.

In 2024, she¬†told The Athletic that it's not "who Carson is" to remain in college as long as he had because of NIL.

‚ÄúThere was no negotiating for money. That‚Äôs not who Kirby is. That‚Äôs not who this program is about, and that‚Äôs not who Carson is,‚Äù she said. ‚ÄúI think it‚Äôs cool he can do NIL this year and have an opportunity for all that. And those boys work so hard. I have never seen kids work as hard as they do. I mean it‚Äôs a full-time job to be a football player at the University of Georgia."

However, Tracy also told The Athletic that she supports Carson's decision to buy a luxury car with his NIL money, as he's been focused on football first.

‚ÄúHe‚Äôs so laid back and so focused on football and Georgia and his team. To him, that‚Äôs such a cool thing and be able to represent and do things for Georgia and for NIL,‚Äù she said. ‚ÄúBut at the end of the day, talking about the car, it‚Äôs just a car. It‚Äôs very cool and amazing that he can drive something like that. But at the end of the day, it‚Äôs more about the team and coming back to try and do what they want to do this year.‚Äù

"Beck's Brigade" is a gameday tailgate support group for Carson Beck that was started by his mother. Per Dawg Nation, Tracy Beck previously said watching Carson play always makes her nervous.

‚ÄúHonestly, he tells me to relax,‚Äù she said, per Dawg Nation. ‚ÄúI promise you that. He says ‚ÄòDon‚Äôt be nervous‚Äô and ‚ÄòBe calm‚Äô and ‚ÄòI‚Äôve got this‚Äô and ‚ÄòTell everybody around you to not be nervous‚Äô because it is nerve-wracking to be the quarterback‚Äôs mom and anybody‚Äôs mom.

‚ÄúNow some games have been close and I‚Äôll cry at the end when we win and I‚Äôll go out on the field.‚Äù

MORE:¬†Ranking the 19 greatest Miami players of all time

Carson Beck's dad is Chris Beck. He is a former player at Navy, where he played linebacker from 1989-92, and he is now a retired Naval officer.

When¬†Carson Beck played for the Pablo Creek Saints, his dad was his coach, per the Atlanta Journal-Constitution.

MORE:Carson Beck's tattoos, explained

No, Carson Beck's parents are no longer married.

It's unknown when Chris and Tracy Beck divorced, but according to EssentiallySports, the couple met in Annapolis, Maryland, before later moving to Florida and welcoming Carson in 2002, then Kylie.

MORE:History of Miami QBs in the NFL, from Jim Kelly to Cam Ward

As of January 2026, Carson Beck hasn't been confirmed to be in a relationship with anyone.

Previously, he was in a high-profile relationship with Hanna Cavinder, a basketball player at Miami and popular social media influencer. Beck and Cavinder began dating in July 2024, per People, but rumors that they had split began in March 2025, not too long after Beck transferred to Miami and joined his girlfriend as a Hurricanes athlete.

At the time, per People, Cavinder had removed all signs of Beck from her Instagram profile, while her twin sister, Haley, posted on social media suggesting she had "a gut feeling about a relationship" and saw "someone in my life that's hurting."

Beck later confirmed his split with Cavinder to ESPN, saying,¬†"You make mistakes as a person, but it sucks that you have to go through something like that with someone that you care about, and now it's all over the Internet."

"Half of what you see in the media is true," Beck told ESPN. "Half of what you see is not true. So, people pick their side of the story and run with it. The people that know the truth know the truth. But it's been difficult."

MORE: When is the last time Miami won a championship in football?

Carson Beck was born and raised in Jacksonville, Florida. He attended¬†Mandarin High School; in¬†2018, he won the Florida "Mr. Football" award after throwing for 3,546 yards and 30 touchdowns as a junior.

Beck led Mandarin to a state championship, and after initially committing to Florida as a baseball prospect, he switched to college football. Beck first committed to Alabama, then flipped his decision to Georgia and joined the Bulldogs in 2020.

Has Carson Beck won a championship?

title: Tyler Herro gets honest about the 'young and fun' Miami Heat this season
description: The Miami Heat have an exciting team this season, and Tyler Herro admits it is one of the most fun he's had in his NBA career.
fullText:
Tyler Herro gets honest about the 'young and fun' Miami Heat this season originally appeared on The Sporting News. Add The Sporting News as a Preferred Source by clicking here.

After a long while with many veterans on the team, the Miami Heat have embraced a younger squad this season. Head coach Erik Spoelstra has implemented a run-and-gun system this season, which has been quite helpful to players like Jaime Jaquez Jr. and Pelle Larsson.

Tyler Herro and Bam Adebayo were once the youngsters of the Heat roster, but now, they are considered the veterans. They are excited about playing for the Heat as the reliable veterans and leaders of this mostly young squad.

The current Heat rotation is filled to the brim with talented youngsters. Names like Jaquez, Larsson, and Nikola Jovic are some of the most promising players on the roster. They fit Spoelstra's new vision of working hard and playing hard at a fast pace.

For Herro and Adebayo, this can be jarring, especially since they played in a Jimmy Butler-centric system. Now that Butler is with the Golden State Warriors, Spoelstra and his system have become much more fast-paced.

More:¬†Heat's Tyler Herro made NBA 3-point history 1 game faster than Steph Curry

Herro is glad and happy to play in this current iteration of the Heat. It has been a rough season for him because he missed plenty of games with an injury. Now that he has returned, the team is ecstatic about his comeback, while he is playing with more youthful players.

"This team, we're young and fun. We got energy, being on the sideline, that‚Äôs one thing I noticed since this season started. I've seen the game through a different lens than on the court. Everyone is coachable and understanding of each other so far. It‚Äôs like everyone is for each other this year; that goes a long way," Herro said in response to a question about the current roster.

Moving forward, the Heat have a promising future with the current squad. It will be a challenging stretch, but in the long run, they could keep developing into a better team. With a good mix of experience and youth, Spoelstra has a strong team that could be even better in the long-term future.

title: CJ McCollum reacts to being traded to Atlanta Hawks for Trae Young
description: Atlanta will be McCollum's fourth franchise in the NBA.
fullText:
CJ McCollum reacts to being traded to Atlanta Hawks for Trae Young originally appeared on The Sporting News. Add The Sporting News as a Preferred Source by clicking here.

CJ McCollum‚Äôs brief tenure with the Washington Wizards has come to an end.

The veteran guard was traded to the Atlanta Hawks, along with Corey Kispert, for star guard Trae Young. The Hawks will be McCollum‚Äôs fourth team in the league following stints with the Portland Trail Blazers, New Orleans Pelicans and Wizards.

McCollum was traded from New Orleans to Washington during the 2025 NBA Draft. In all, he appeared in 35 games for Washington and posted averages of 18.8 points, 3.6 assists and 3.5 rebounds in 30.9 minutes per performance.

After news of the trade broke, McCollum, 34, reacted to the deal by expressing gratitude for his time in D.C. and excitement about his future in Atlanta.

‚ÄúLoved my time in DC,‚Äù McCollum said, via NBA insider Chris Haynes. ‚ÄúOrganization was great to my family and I. Michael Winger and Will [Dawkins] did everything they said they would and kept their word from the very beginning. Love the city and they‚Äôre doing things the right way over there.

"Exited to get to The A and get to work. Very familiar with their style of play. Love the ownership group and front office. Good group of players.‚Äù

It certainly doesn‚Äôt sound like McCollum harbors any ill will towards the Wizards organization for trading him, but if he does, he won‚Äôt have to wait too long to exact some revenge. The Hawks will host the Wizards for back-to-back games on Feb. 24 and 26.

Ultimately, McCollum's stay in Atlanta, like his stay in Washington, could be a short one. He's headed for unrestricted free agency over the offseason, and there's no guarantee that he'll be back in Atlanta. But, if he proves to be a valuable addition to the Hawks this season, he'll boost his own stock in the process.

title: Arc Raiders Tops The Charts While Battlefield 6 Drops In PlayStation's Top Games Of December 2025
description:
Shooters and sports games were quite popular for PlayStation players during the holiday season, with the record-setting Arc Raiders ending its successful first year in the top spot of the PSN charts for December 2025 in the United States and Canada.
Not far from the relatively cheap extraction game are fellow shooters Call of Duty: Black Ops 7 at No. 3 and Grand Theft Auto 5 at No. 5, along with a cavalcade of sports titles that include NBA 2K26 at No. 2, Madden NFL 26 at No.
fullText:
on January 7, 2026 at 8:50AM PST

GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.

Shooters and sports games were quite popular for PlayStation players during the holiday season, with the record-setting Arc Raiders ending its successful first year in the top spot of the PSN charts for December 2025 in the United States and Canada.

Not far from the relatively cheap extraction game are fellow shooters Call of Duty: Black Ops 7 at No. 3 and Grand Theft Auto 5 at No. 5, along with a cavalcade of sports titles that include NBA 2K26 at No. 2, Madden NFL 26 at No. 4, and EA Sports FC 26 at No. 6.

Faltering in the charts, however, is Battlefield 6, though it still remains in a respectable No. 8 spot on December's list. Meanwhile, Marvel Cosmic Invasion, which launched at the beginning of December, is at No. 18, while Avatar: Frontiers of Pandora rides the wave from a new DLC expansion tying into the new Avatar film to land in the No. 14 position.

On the PlayStation 4 side, Red Dead Redemption 2 continues to dominate in both North America and the European Union, while Plants vs. Zombies: Garden Warfare 2 (which is currently available at a steep discount on the PSN store) surprises by shooting up in the No. 3 spot. In the States, four different Five Nights at Freddy's titles take up spots on the PS4 list.

Beat Saber was the most-played PS VR2 game last month, though the game is discontinuing support and online multiplayer this month. Finally, Fortnite ended up as the top free-to-play game in December, likely owing to its annual Winterfest festivities.

Check out the full breakdown of PlayStation's top games for December 2025 in North America and Europe below.

title: A massive women‚Äôs hoops inflection point, plus NFL firings
description: The Athletic has live coverage of Bears vs. 49ers on NFL ‚ÄúSunday Night Football.‚Äù Good morning! Keep your job today. Inside: üèÄ Unrivaled‚Äôs return üóëÔ∏è Black Monday recap üß≥ NBA star on the move?
fullText:
The Athletic has live coverage of Bears vs. 49ers on NFL ‚ÄúSunday Night Football.‚Äù

Good morning! Keep your job today. Inside:

Every moment of the past two years has felt like an inflection point for women‚Äôs basketball in America. Viewership is surging. Will they capitalize?

It kind of defeats the entire definition of an inflection point, but if there really is one, the sport has arrived at its doorstep now. Consider:

The WNBA, after a spike in popularity, is undergoing a contentious negotiation for a new collective bargaining agreement. Salaries and revenue are set to explode. The question is just how the players and league will agree to share the boom.

The sport‚Äôs rise has manifested in other ways. As recently as a couple years ago, it was standard for WNBA players ‚Äî afforded meager salaries compared to those in other pro sports ‚Äî to travel overseas to make big money during the offseason.

Enter new leagues like Unrivaled, which opened its second season last night, and Project B, a new venture that will launch in November. While there are differences ‚Äî Unrivaled is a three-on-three sport, while Project B is more akin to the full game but with a wide travel schedule ‚Äî they offer similar things: more money, and player equity in the league.

Unrivaled started its sophomore year with four games last night, highlighted by the Mist, an expansion franchise, winning its first game, and Rose, the defending champions, winning by 20. My favorite bit about watching these games: The league uses a modified version of the Elam Ending, in which teams play three timed quarters, but the fourth quarter is untimed. The first team to reach a certain point total (11 points more than the leading team has after three quarters) wins.

I asked Ben Pickman, who wrote an excellent preview of the Unrivaled year yesterday, about whether he thinks the league has a chance to make an imprint on the larger sports world this year:

‚ÄúUnrivaled already excels at creating social media content that puts WNBA players fully onto viewer radars during the winter. What will be interesting is how its viewership continues to grow and whether fans become more invested in the nightly results of its games. The league‚Äôs viewership on TNT and truTV in Year 1 was comparable to the NWSL‚Äôs viewership on ESPN networks this past season, and though it is far behind the WNBA‚Äôs viewership, the two leagues are of course at varying points in their history.‚Äù

Ben also made an interesting point to me: With the NBA off TNT, Paige Bueckers, who plays for the Breeze, is the second-most famous athlete broadcast by TNT Sports, behind only Shohei Ohtani.

These are exciting things. Let‚Äôs move on to something a little more dour:

We discussed the looming specter of ‚ÄúBlack Monday‚Äù yesterday ‚Äî the day most NFL coaches get fired. That part came to fruition. What we didn‚Äôt expect was the firings to extend beyond the American version of football.

Cleveland canned Kevin Stefanski after six years in charge, which saw two playoff appearances, a disastrous trade for Deshaun Watson and a sack record all achieved amid boggling highs and lows. Jason Lloyd writes that, despite those temporary highs, Stefanski leaves behind a lot of bad things.

The Cardinals fired Jonathan Gannon after three largely unsuccessful seasons. He finishes his tenure 15-36 with no playoff appearances. Tough timing after the team‚Äôs X account wished him a happy birthday Sunday.

Pete Carroll is officially one-and-done in Las Vegas, which feels like a sad line in what probably will be a Hall of Fame career (a convo for another day). General manager John Spytek, hired last offseason with Carroll, will remain in his role and help Tom Brady with the coaching search. What a weird year.

We‚Äôll have to wait on movement for replacements, as plenty of those candidates are still coaching for playoff teams. One curious name to consider, though: Philip Rivers.

Now, to the surprising news from across the ocean we briefly mentioned yesterday:

Manchester United is done with manager Ruben Amorim after a maddening 14-month tenure that began with lofty promise. Amorim‚Äôs critics viewed him as inflexible, though his tactics were successful elsewhere. Man Utd finished 15th in the Premier League table last season and sits sixth right now. One thing will be missed: Amorim‚Äôs bizarre news conferences.

In other soccer sacking news, Celtic parted with Wilfried Nancy after just 33 days in charge. He joined Dec. 3 after a stint with the Columbus Crew. His early dismissal set records.

Woof. Let‚Äôs move on to some more ‚Ä¶ normal news.

Hawks, Young working on trade

Atlanta and star guard Trae Young are discussing a possible trade, a source confirmed to The Athletic, which has been a long time coming on a few different levels. Young is still just 27 and in his prime, and still possesses the ability to be an elite scorer. But it‚Äôs very clear the Hawks are a better team without him this year, and he can enter free agency after the season. Read our full story here, which includes a potential suitor.

Montana State wins wild FCS title game

Montana State won its first FCS championship since 1984 last night, 35-34 over Illinois State, which had become the Cinderella of the FCS tournament bracket. The game itself was unhinged, and ended after the Bobcats converted a fourth-and-10 for a touchdown in overtime on a pass from quarterback Justin Lamson to Taco Dowler (sweet name). That was merely the caboose for what transpired in the minutes before. The full recap is worth a read.

Sweden outlasted Czechia to win its first World Juniors gold medal since 2012 yesterday. More details inside.

Indiana and Alabama drew a record 23.9 million viewers for their Rose Bowl matchup. Yowza.

Dolphins quarterback Tua Tagovailoa is open to a fresh start with a new team. Hm.

Colts cornerback Charvarius Ward Sr. said yesterday he is considering retirement after suffering three concussions this season. Read the 29-year-old‚Äôs full comments.

Tough flip: Notre Dame quarterback Kenny Minchey is heading to Kentucky, just hours after he committed to Nebraska.

F1 driver Checo P√©rez said being Max Verstappen‚Äôs teammate at Red Bull was the ‚Äúworst job.‚Äù Yikes.

üì∫ NCAAM: Duke at Louisville

7 p.m. ET on ESPN

The Blue Devils are ranked No. 6 and have the star power, while the Cardinals are No. 20 and still favored in this game. Sounds like a good sell to me.

üì∫ NHL: Panthers at Maple Leafs

7:30 p.m. ET on TNT and HBO Max

The defending champions have steadied a bit after a tough start to the season, while Toronto remains moribund, which has been a slow-burn surprise. 

üì∫ NBA: Heat at Timberwolves

8 p.m. ET on NBC and Peacock

The best NBA game of the evening is here, and it‚Äôs funny that the 23-13 Timberwolves are flying under the proverbial radar a bit. Still great with a Tier 1 scorer, but sitting sixth in the West and biding time until the playoffs. Don‚Äôt sleep on them, though.

Get tickets to games like these here.

We had a scheduling mix-up last week, for which we apologize. Here is the excellent story we promised you then: Katie Whyatt‚Äôs look at how sex workers have increasingly used European soccer clubs as sort of a brand boost on social media. Read it here.

Nick Baumgardner has a new 2026 NFL mock draft with Oregon QB Dante Moore going No. 1 to Las Vegas. Moore might be deciding between being the No. 1 pick and staying in college.

Dan Duggan tore into Giants ownership yesterday for retaining general manager Joe Schoen, arguing the franchise has ‚Äúno standards anymore.‚Äù Make time for this one.

Important table-setter: Ken Rosenthal and Will Sammon update us on where the Cubs, Yankees and Blue Jays stand as the MLB offseason withers away.

Most-clicked in the newsletter yesterday: NFL playoff schedule.

Most-read on the website yesterday: Our projections of every NFL playoff team‚Äôs odds to win the Super Bowl.

üì´ That‚Äôs all for now! Say hello at thepulse@theathletic.com, and check out our other newsletters.

title: Should the Boston Celtics go all-in and be buyers at the 2026 NBA trade deadline?
description: The frontcourt stands out in particular as an area of need, with the Celtics needing a bit of veteran experience and a different style of big play.
fullText:
Should the Boston Celtics go all-in and be buyers at the 2026 NBA trade deadline? Given the fact that star Celtics forward Jaylen Brown has been playing at the level of a bona fide Most Valuable Player candidate so far this season and that Boston has defied the odds alongside him to claw their way up to the Eastern Conference's third-place spot, there is a very strong case that they ought to be on the hunt for some talent to add to the roster.

The frontcourt stands out in particular as an area of need, with the Celtics needing a little bit of veteran experience and a different style of big man play to put next to blossoming young big man Neemias Queta. The folks behind the "WEEI Boston's Sports Original" YouTube channel put together a clip from their "Greg Hill" show that takes a deeper look at what Boston ought to do in light of their unexpected success this season.

Take a look at the clip embedded below to hear what they had to say about potential Celtics trades and more.

title: TST Best Bets- January 5, 2026
description: Monday‚Äôs NBA and NHL slates present plenty of betting opportunities as teams hit midseason form and trends across both leagues turn into dependable indicators.
fullText:
Monday‚Äôs NBA and NHL slates present plenty of betting opportunities as teams hit midseason form and trends across both leagues turn into dependable indicators. As January rolls on, separation on the hardwood and ice sharpens betting lines, creating clearer opportunities at the window. ¬†Here are tonight‚Äôs best bets brought to you by BetOnline.ag. All new players get a 50% welcome bonus and up to $250 in free bets.

Rundown: The Los Angeles Kings (17-14-9) wrap up a two-game home set against the Minnesota Wild (25-10-8) on Monday night at Crypto.com Arena.

Los Angeles enters tonight‚Äôs contest riding the momentum of a 5-4 shootout win over Minnesota on Saturday, a result that stood out given the Kings‚Äô season-long offensive struggles. Ranked 31st in goals per game, Los Angeles capitalized on its chances against a Wild team that had won eight of its previous 10 contests, with Adrian Kempe recording a two-point night to spark the breakthrough performance. While the final score reflected a wide-open game, much of the damage came from situational lapses rather than sustained offensive pressure.

Despite Saturday‚Äôs nine-goal outburst, both teams continue to lean on structure and goal prevention as their foundation. The Kings rank third in the NHL in goals allowed per game (2.65), relying on disciplined defensive-zone coverage and limiting high-danger chances, a style that has pushed 22 of their 40 games (55%) below the posted total. Minnesota enters with a similar identity, excelling at controlling tempo and suppressing second-chance opportunities.

Expect a sharper, more methodical approach in the rematch, with both teams tightening neutral-zone play and limiting rush chances. With goaltending and defensive structure likely to dictate the pace, this matchup sets up for a lower-scoring outcome this time around.

Rundown: The Los Angeles Clippers (12-22) close out a five-game homestand on Monday night as they host the Golden State Warriors (19-17) at Intuit Dome.

Los Angeles looks to rebound after a 31-point blowout loss to Boston that snapped its six-game winning streak and dropped the Clippers back to 10 games under the .500 mark. Jaylen Brown‚Äôs 50-point outburst exposed some of Los Angeles‚Äô season-long offensive issues, as the Clippers continue to rank near the bottom of the league in scoring efficiency. Despite the uneven record, Los Angeles‚Äô recent surge has translated to the betting market, covering seven of its last 10 games and posting an 8‚Äì8 record against the spread when listed as underdogs of 2.5 points or more. Kawhi Leonard and James Harden will be tasked with generating efficient looks against a Golden State defense that ranks seventh in the NBA in points allowed (113.9 per game) and does a strong job limiting perimeter scoring.

On the other side, Golden State enters playing its best basketball in weeks, winning six of its last eight contests behind the continued brilliance of Stephen Curry. At 37 years old, Curry remains the engine of the Warriors‚Äô offense, averaging 28.8 points per game, ninth-highest in the league. While Golden State‚Äôs recent success has boosted its position in the standings, it has not consistently carried over to the betting window, as the Warriors have covered just three of their last 10 games and sit 15-21 ATS on the season. As favorites of 2.5 points or more, Golden State has struggled to separate, owning a 9-14-1 ATS record in those spots.

Expect Los Angeles to lean on home-court energy and create opportunities in key spots, keeping this matchup within a single possession as the final buzzer sounds.

title: Suns stun NBA-best Thunder as East-leading Pistons top Cavs
description: Devin Booker drilled the game-winning three-pointer in the final second as the Phoenix Suns rallied to silence the NBA champion Oklahoma City Thunder 108-105 on Sunday.That gave Phoenix a 105-101 lead, but Oklahoma City tied it at 105-105 with 8.2 seconds left before Booker connected.
fullText:
Devin Booker drilled the game-winning three-pointer in the final second as the Phoenix Suns rallied to silence the NBA champion Oklahoma City Thunder 108-105 on Sunday.

The Suns erased an early 18-point deficit to avenge the worst defeat in franchise history -- a 138-89 loss to the league-leading Thunder in the NBA Cup quarter-finals last month.

Booker scored 24 points and handed out nine assists and Dillon Brooks added 22 for Phoenix -- which had a career-high 26 points off the bench from Jordan Goodwin.

Brooks drained a three-pointer over Canada teammate and Oklahoma City's reigning NBA Most Valuable Player Shai Gilgeous-Alexander with 36 seconds remaining.

That gave Phoenix a 105-101 lead, but Oklahoma City tied it at 105-105 with 8.2 seconds left before Booker connected.

Gilgeous-Alexander led the Thunder with 25 points and Jalen Williams added 23, but the Suns snapped Oklahoma City's four-game winning streak.

The Thunder's 30-6 record remains the best in the league, while Detroit boosted their Eastern Conference lead with a 114-110 victory over the Cleveland Cavaliers that moved the Pistons to 26-9.

Cade Cunningham scored 27 points and reserve Daniss Jenkins added 25 -- including 21 in a dazzling second quarter for Detroit.

Star guard Cunningham added six rebounds, seven assists, two steals and a blocked shot as the Pistons shrugged off the injury absences of key contributors Tobias Harris, Jalen Duren and Caris LeVert.

But Jenkins stole the show with his monster second quarter in which he made all seven of his shots, including six three-pointers.

"My teammates were just finding me and I was open," said Jenkins, who is playing on a two-way contract. "I was given space and the key to the game was (if) you've got an open shot, you've got to shoot."

The Cavs, led by 30 points from Donovan Mitchell, whittled a 13-point deficit to two with 1:16 remaining and were within two again with 3.8 seconds left, but Jenkins made two free throws to seal it.

The Cavaliers, touted at the start of the season as contenders in the East, finished the day eighth in the standings after being overtaken by the Miami Heat, who beat the New Orleans Pelicans 125-106.

The Los Angeles Lakers closed the weekend with a 120-114 clutch home win over the Memphis Grizzlies.

Luka Doncic scored 36 points with nine rebounds and eight assists.

LeBron James and Jake LaRavia added 26 points each for the Lakers, who erased a 16-point deficit and finally pulled away late in a game in which the Grizzlies led by one point with 5:29 remaining.

Meanwhile, the Indiana Pacers matched a franchise record for futility with their 12th straight defeat, falling 135-127 to the Magic in Orlando.

The Pacers have been a shadow of the team that fell in last season's NBA Finals, with a string of players hit by injuries since star Tyrese Haliburton suffered a torn Achilles tendon in the championship series.

Pacers forward Pascal Siakam led all scorers with 34 points, but the Magic -- led by 31 points from Desmond Bane -- seized control with a 17-0 run in the second quarter and held on in the face of a late Pacers surge.

The Brooklyn Nets took advantage of Denver star Nikola Jokic's absence to beat the Nuggets 127-115.

In their third game since Jokic‚Äôs injury, the Nuggets fell despite the return of Christian Braun and Aaron Gordon from long injury absences.

Jamal Murray led Denver with 27 points and set a career high with 16 assists. Braun finished with three points in 24 minutes while Gordon had 20 points in 21 minutes.

But without three-time Most Valuable Player Jokic it wasn't enough, thanks largely to the efforts of former Nugget Michael Porter Jr -- who scored 27 points and grabbed 11 rebounds in his first meeting with the Nuggets since he was traded in July.

title: Checking Up On Brockton Native And Potential No. 1 Pick AJ Dybantsa
description: AJ Dybantsa has lived up to his billing this season as the potential No. 1 overall selection in the 2026 NBA draft. The BYU 18-year-old freshman ‚Äî originally from Brockton ‚Äî is dominating college basketball defenders at the moment. Earlier in the season, Dybantsa dropped 25 points at Madison Square Garden in front of Jaylen [‚Ä¶]
fullText:
AJ Dybantsa has lived up to his billing this season as the potential No. 1 overall selection in the 2026 NBA draft. The BYU 18-year-old freshman ‚Äî originally from Brockton ‚Äî is dominating college basketball defenders at the moment.

Earlier in the season, Dybantsa dropped 25 points at Madison Square Garden in front of Jaylen Brown and Derrick White in attendance, and AJ has stockpiled those kinds of scoring performances as the season has gone on.

Bleacher Report‚Äôs Andy Bailey recently predicted that Dybantsa will indeed be the first pick in the draft, despite competition from two other guys.

‚ÄúRight now, there are three very real contenders to be the top pick in the 2026 draft: Cameron Boozer, Darryn Peterson and AJ Dybantsa,‚Äù Bailey wrote on January 1.

‚ÄúAll three have been incredibly¬†productive¬†as freshmen. And the talent gaps between them (assuming there are any) are small enough that it might come down to which team wins the lottery.‚Äù

‚ÄúIf someone needs a bigger forward, Boozer would be the pick,‚Äù Bailey continued. ‚ÄúA team in need of a dynamic lead guard could go with Peterson. But Dybantsa checks boxes that both of the others do, and wing is the easiest player archetype to build around. And if Dybantsa keeps playing through conference games the way he has in his last six appearances (when he‚Äôs averaged 27.8 points, 8.0 rebounds, 5.7 assists and 2.3 steals), he‚Äôll enter the summer with a ton of momentum.‚Äù

Potential No. 1 pick AJ Dybantsa's last 7 games:

24 PTS | 8-15 FG | 8 REB | 3 AST
33 PTS | 11-13 FG | 10 REB | 10 AST
35 PTS | 9-12 FG | 6 REB | 4 AST
23 PTS | 8-14 FG | 10 REB
26 PTS | 11-17 FG | 8 REB | 7 AST
28 PTS | 9-17 FG | 9 REB | 6 AST
22 PTS | 10-15 FG | 5 REB | 5 AST pic.twitter.com/2LkrcwPCqO

‚Äî B/R Hoops (@brhoops) January 3, 2026

Dybantsa has electrified BYU basketball in his first 14 games played. The 6-foot-8 wing, a preseason AP All-American, joined the Cougars after reclassifying and committing in late 2024.

Early on in the season, Dybantsa faced challenges, including a narrow 86-84 loss to UConn where he contributed despite team struggles. But he ignited in December. His standout effort came against Clemson on December 9, engineering a 22-point comeback by scoring or assisting on 34 of BYU‚Äôs 45 second-half points in a 67-64 victory. He followed with a career-high 35 points versus Abilene Christian and made NCAA history on December 23 against Eastern Washington, posting the youngest-ever 30-point triple-double: 33 points on 11-of-13 shooting, 10 rebounds, and 10 assists.

Entering Big 12 play, Dybantsa earned Lute Olson National Player of the Week on December 15 and Big 12 Player of the Week on December 30. In the conference opener on January 3, he scored 24 points despite seven turnovers, leading No. 10 BYU to an 83-73 road win over Kansas State, extending their streak to 10 victories. Through early January, he‚Äôs averaging 23.1 points, 7.2 rebounds, and 3.8 assists on 59.1 percent shooting, positioning BYU as a Final Four contender while solidifying his NBA Draft stock.

LeBron James Retirement Timeline Predicted By Andy Bailey

fullText:

Jaylen Brown is on a mission for the Boston Celtics.

As the league expected the Celtics to enter the 2025-2026 NBA season with a gap-year approach, they‚Äôve done the opposite. Brown‚Äôs contributions have been a major reason why the Celtics aren‚Äôt slipping in the Eastern Conference without Jayson Tatum.

title: Is Jalen Suggs banned from wearing headband on his neck?
description: Jalen Suggs has worn his headband on his neck in a peculiar fashion choice. The NBA isn't happy.
fullText:
Orlando Magic guard Jalen Suggs has made the unusual fashion choice of wearing his headband around his neck this season. It's a nod to his "football drip" from high school, Suggs explains, as he was a prized quarterback who held a scholarship offer from SEC powerhouse Georgia before taking the basketball path at Gonzaga.

Whether you like the headband-on-neck look or not, the NBA has taken it away. The Magic broadcast revealed Friday that Suggs has been banned from styling his headband the way he has been. It harkens back to when the NBA banned players from wearing double headbands after Tim Thomas briefly tried to popularize the trend while playing for the Milwaukee Bucks in 2002.

It's worth noting Suggs never wore the headband around his neck for the entire game. He'd play the first few minutes with it there before transferring the headband to its standard position around his forehead.

Kendra Douglas mentions that the league told Jalen Suggs that the headband must be on his head to begin basketball games pic.twitter.com/ap3UqPKyKf

‚Äî The Magic Way (@MagicFilmRoom) January 3, 2026

Jalen Suggs getting the ‚Äúneck headband‚Äù banned by the NBA reminds me of when Tim Thomas got the ‚Äúdouble headband‚Äù banned in 2002 pic.twitter.com/y28I07W26R

‚Äî Average Basketball Players (@avgbballplayers) January 3, 2026

Suggs is averaging 15 points, 4.7 assists and 3.7 assists this season. He's an excellent perimeter defender with 1.9 steals per game. The former No. 5 overall pick has missed time with a hip contusion and knee strain, however, prompting concern considering he's only played more than 53 games once across his first four NBA seasons.

Orlando will hope to have Suggs healthy and as tenacious as ever for the playoffs, though he won't have his signature look.

This article originally appeared on For The Win: Is Magic star Jalen Suggs banned from wearing headband on his neck?

title: Bill Simmons calls out Lakers for clear struggles in December
description: NBA podcaster Bill Simmons highlighted the Lakers' struggles in December.
fullText:
Bill Simmons calls out Lakers for clear struggles in December originally appeared on The Sporting News. Add The Sporting News as a Preferred Source by clicking here.

The Los Angeles Lakers had a strange run in December to close out 2025.

After being one of the top teams in a tough Western Conference through the first few months of the season, the Lakers have hit a rough patch. The Ringer‚Äôs Bill Simmons wanted to highlight the deficits for the Lakers‚Äô seven losses before ringing in the new year.

via @BillSimmons: The Lakers had 7 losses in December ‚Äî by 17, 21. 13, 15, 24, 23 and 22 points. Happy New Year!

The Lakers finished December 2025 with a 5-7 record.

Although the team was hopeful to find better chemistry with LeBron James back in the mix full-time after his rare absence early on, it simply hasn‚Äôt clicked yet for the Lakers.

Defensively, the Lakers have been struggling all season long and they continue to trend in the wrong direction. The head coach, JJ Redick, reached a breaking point, calling out his team for its lack of execution, and the players aren‚Äôt exactly pushing back.

The seven losses occurred against the Phoenix Suns, Boston Celtics, San Antonio Spurs, Los Angeles Clippers, Houston Rockets, and the Detroit Pistons. Everybody listed is within the postseason picture for the time being, which isn‚Äôt a great look for a Lakers team that wants to contend for a title.

The Lakers are back on the court on Saturday night to take on the Memphis Grizzlies. They are now chasing the Houston Rockets in the standings, trailing by one game for the fifth seed.

title: Russell Westbrook passes Oscar Robertson as all-time scoring leader among point guards
description: The Kings guard is now 15th overall on the NBA all-time scoring list.
fullText:
Russell Westbrook has another place in the NBA record books.

The former MVP reached 26,711 career points on Friday, passing Oscar Robertson to become the NBA's all-time scoring leader among point guards. Robertson was previously the top scorer at the position with 26,710 points.

Westbrook finished the game with 17 points on 6-of-12 shooting, 9 rebounds, 6 assists and 4 turnovers in the Sacramento Kings' 129-102 loss to the Phoenix Suns.

Brodie passes The Big O üëë 

Congrats to @russwest44 for becoming the NBA's all-time leading scorer for a point guard. pic.twitter.com/GOeQmKihE8

‚Äî Sacramento Kings (@SacramentoKings) January 3, 2026

Westbrook was already the NBA's all-time leader in triple-doubles and in rebounds among guards. He is seventh on the all-time assists leaderboard, and is on pace to pass Mark Jackson and Steve Nash for fifth by the end of the season.

Of course, with the scoring record, the point guard distinction is an unofficial one. There are now 14 players ahead of Westbrook on the NBA's all-time leading scorer list and only three of them are guards: Kobe Bryant, Michael Jordan, James Harden. Jordan and Bryant are both quintessential shooting guards, while Harden has spent his career in more of a combo role.

Westbrook has spent his post-Oklahoma City Thunder career as something of a journeyman, joining the Kings this season on a one-year, $3.6 million contract (aka the veteran minimum). He has still averaged double-digit points in every season of his career and currently ranks fourth on the Kings with 14.4 points per game, his highest output since the 2022-23 season.

He also entered Friday shooting 42.3% from the field, his worst mark since 2010, but that's partially offset by a career high 35.3% clip from 3-point range.

It was a tough night if you hate seeing less-heralded Oscar Robertson records go down, as Giannis Antetokounmpo surpassed him to become the all-time leader in 30-10-5 games. What a time to be alive.

title: Giannis dunk lifts Bucks, NBA champion Thunder roll on
description: Giannis Antetokounmpo threw down the game-winning dunk with 4.7 seconds remaining to lift the Milwaukee Bucks to a 122-121 victory over the Charlotte Hornets and grab a slice of NBA history on Friday.The Bucks trailed by as many as 16 on their home floor, but Antetokounmpo scored 12 of his 30 points in the final quarter to help seal the win in a frantic finish that saw five lead changes in the final 45.7 seconds.
fullText:
Giannis Antetokounmpo threw down the game-winning dunk with 4.7 seconds remaining to lift the Milwaukee Bucks to a 122-121 victory over the Charlotte Hornets and grab a slice of NBA history on Friday.

The Bucks trailed by as many as 16 on their home floor, but Antetokounmpo scored 12 of his 30 points in the final quarter to help seal the win in a frantic finish that saw five lead changes in the final 45.7 seconds.

The two-time NBA Most Valuable Player added 10 rebounds and five assists.

It was his 158th regular-season game with at least 30 points, 10 rebounds and five assists, overtaking Kareem Abdul-Jabbar and Oscar Robertson for the most in NBA history.

"It's an incredible accomplishment," Antetokounmpo said.

"I don't want to come here and just do my job and go back home," he said. "I just want to keep on evolving, keep on learning."

The Bucks, whose erratic season included an eight-game injury absence for Antetokounmpo in December, improved to 15-20.

"We're not there yet, but we're trending towards the right direction," Antetokounmpo said after Milwaukee's third win in four games.

The NBA champion Oklahoma City Thunder romped to an 131-94 victory over a Golden State Warriors team missing the star trio of Stephen Curry, Draymond Green and Jimmy Butler.

Reigning MVP Shai Gilgeous-Alexander scored 30 points and Chet Holmgren added 15 points, 15 rebounds and four blocked shots for OKC, who became the first team this season to reach 30 wins as they improved to 30-5.

In Cleveland, Donovan Mitchell scored 33 points and Darius Garland added 18 as the Cavaliers edged the injury-depleted Denver Nuggets 113-108.

Three-time NBA MVP Nikola Jokic was among four sidelined Nuggets starters as he continues to recover from a hyperextended left knee.

The Nuggets took a 97-88 lead into the fourth quarter and led 105-101 with 4:43 remaining before the Cavs reeled off 10 straight points in a spurt that included a go-ahead three-pointer from Garland.

Cleveland outscored Denver 25-11 in the final period. Jamal Murray led the visitors with 34 points but had just six in the second half.

"I feel like the first three quarters, we just really weren't ourselves," Mitchell said after the Cavaliers' third straight win, adding that the key to keeping the victories coming was "to be that team we were defensively -- we know we can be and everything else takes care of itself."

De'Aaron Fox scored 24 points and grabbed seven rebounds to lead the short-handed San Antonio Spurs to a 123-113 victory over the reeling Indiana Pacers.

San Antonio's French superstar Victor Wembanyama skipped the trip to Indianapolis after hyperextending his left knee in a win over the New York Knicks on Wednesday.

Spurs coach Mitch Johnson said Wembanyama could return for Saturday's home game against the Portland Trail Blazers.

Pascal Siakam scored 23 points for the Pacers, who trailed the entire second half on the way to an 11th straight defeat.

Atlanta forward Jalen Johnson's seventh triple-double of the season propelled the Hawks to a 111-99 victory over the Knicks in New York.

Johnson scored 18 points with 10 rebounds and 11 assists and Nickeil Alexander-Walker and Onyeka Okongwu added 23 points apiece for the Hawks.

Jalen Brunson scored 24 points to lead the Knicks, who heard boos from a Madison Square Garden crowd unwilling to make allowances for a team missing Karl-Anthony Towns and Mitchell Robinson.

fullText:
The Boston Celtics have won six of seven. Jaylen Brown dropped 29 points on Thursday night in Sacramento as the Celts pulled away from the Kings late in a 120-106 victory. Boston is now 21-12 on the season, maintaining their spot as the third-best team in the Eastern Conference.

Following Thursday‚Äôs NBA slate, the Celtics are 3.5 games back of the first-place Detroit Pistons and two games back of the second-place New York Knicks.

Brown added 10 rebounds and four assists to his box score versus the Kings. The MVP candidate is now averaging 29.5 points, 6.4 rebounds, and 5.0 assists per game in 31 games played this season. He‚Äôs shooting 50.3 percent from the field.

Jaylen Brown this season

29.5 PPG (50.3% FG)
6.4 RPG

Brown actually fouled out of this game late in the fourth quarter on a controversial call that Joe Mazzulla challenged. The game was already in hand at that point. It wasn‚Äôt the most efficient game for Brown (11-25 FG), but there was no one on the Kings who could stop JB whenever he felt like driving to the cup.

On multiple occasions, Brown decided to merely put his head down and use his athleticism on a straight line to the rim; no fancy moves needed. One such example occurred at the end of the first half, when Brown used a basic between-the-legs dribble to advance past the older DeMar DeRozan for a left-handed finish.

Jaylen to end the half. Too easy pic.twitter.com/zM94ffFiuN

Boston‚Äôs second-highest scorers on the night were Derrick White and Payton Pritchard, each dropping 16 points. Sam Hauser scored 15 off the bench on an efficient 5-of-7 from 3. Anfernee Simons was similarly effective, tallying 14 off the pine (4-of-7 from distance).

The Celtics out-rebounded the Kings, 40-32. Sacramento was sharp from the line (14-15 FT) but merely room temperature from downtown (33 percent), mostly due to Russell Westbrook (2-for-9) and Dennis Schr√∂der (3-for-8) combining for 12 long-distance bricks.

Next up for the Celtics is a Saturday night showdown with the Clippers in Los Angeles. The Clips have been playing well of late and Kawhi Leonard looks rejuvenated. It‚Äôll be a nice test for Boston.

title: Lakers urged to cut ties with declining $101 million superstar before trade deadline
description: An NBA writer didn't mince his words on the Los Angeles Lakers' 41-year-old forward.
fullText:
Lakers urged to cut ties with declining $101 million superstar before trade deadline originally appeared on The Sporting News. Add The Sporting News as a Preferred Source by clicking here.

The Los Angeles Lakers are slowly slipping into mediocrity.

The franchise‚Äôs horrid defense is holding them back from greatness, as the Detroit Pistons were the latest team to give the 17-time NBA champions fits (they secured a 128-106 victory over the Lakers on Tuesday night).

In Lake Show Life‚Äôs Tyler Watts‚Äô opinion, the Lakers‚Äô declining superstar is also at fault for the organization‚Äôs uninspiring play, which should lead to a trade.

‚ÄúThe Lakers have been awful with their three stars sharing the floor this season,‚Äù Watts wrote Monday. "Luka Doncic is locked in as the centerpiece. ‚ÄúLos Angeles has to choose between LeBron (James) and AR (Austin Reaves) for his co-star. Both will be free agents in the offseason, and fans know what makes the most sense.‚Äù

‚ÄúThey don‚Äôt want to trade Reaves when he‚Äôs injured, and LeBron‚Äôs value is at an all-time low. Multiple teams would still bite on King James based on the sales alone, but that is not the Laker way.‚Äù

‚ÄúThey are known for taking care of their stars and allowing them to retire wearing the purple and gold. The Lakers should move on from LeBron, but that isn‚Äôt how they operate.‚Äù

‚ÄúLeBron is 41 years old and clearly declining. The Lakers have been outscored by 7.1 points per 100 possessions with him on the floor this season and have a 125.8 defensive rating. Those numbers are atrocious and resemble nothing near what a title contender puts up.‚Äù

Unless James picks it up on the defensive end and shows he can play a more well-rounded brand of basketball moving forward, James will justifiably be considered a shell of his former self.

Although a decline was bound to occur with James being the oldest player in the NBA, the 21-time All-Star shouldn‚Äôt receive a pass for his lackluster play on the hardwood.

As Watts noted, James has played well enough to generate sufficient trade interest (a deal would only work if James approved it), which would hypothetically allow the Lakers to acquire roster-bolstering contributors in a blockbuster transaction.

Whether he likes it or not, James isn‚Äôt an untouchable asset in Year 23.

More NBA:¬†Proposed Lakers trade involving LeBron James lands $110 million Warriors superstar

title: What is the Best Christmas Day Game in Jazz History?
description: Christmas and the NBA have been synonymous since the league‚Äôs inception. The very first Christmas Day game was played in 1947 at Madison Square Garden between the New York Knicks and Providence Steam Rollers. The Utah Jazz themselves have been a part of this great Christmas tradition, playing eight games on the beloved holiday. Jazz [‚Ä¶] The post What is the Best Christmas Day Game in Jazz History? appeared first on The Lead.
fullText:
Christmas and the NBA have been synonymous since the league‚Äôs inception. The very first Christmas Day game was played in 1947 at Madison Square Garden between the New York Knicks and Providence Steam Rollers. The Utah Jazz themselves have been a part of this great Christmas tradition, playing eight games on the beloved holiday.

Jazz fans have fond memories of the six wins and probably have forgotten the two losses they‚Äôve sustained throughout, but which is the best Jazz Christmas game? To commemorate this holiday tradition, The Lead has done its research to rank these Jazz Christmas games from worst to best.

Disclaimer: there are only a select few games that have footage to go with them. Each game was ranked by the story behind it, how the game played out, and what players made the biggest impact.

When it came to the most lackluster of the games, the Jazz vs the Phoenix Suns was the worst.

The game was played on Dec. 25, 1982, and the Jazz found themselves struggling to defend throughout the game. At one point in the third quarter, they were down by at least 20. They did manage a small comeback, but it wasn‚Äôt enough with the score being 111-101, Suns.

The only bright spots in that game were the combined effort of Jeff Wilkins, Ben Poquette, and Danny Schayes, scoring 58 of the Jazz‚Äôs 101 points. Number seven is the Jazz vs the San Antonio Spurs.

The seventh-place game on this list was played on Dec 25, 1977, against the Spurs (one of the last years the Jazz were in New Orleans). This game was between two 70s basketball heavyweights, Pistol Pete Maravich and George Gervin.

Though the Jazz were never really close to winning, they weren‚Äôt blown out, and it was a little closer in score. Maravich led the Jazz with 27 points, four steals, and four rebounds. Gervin led the Spurs with 31 points, two blocks, five assists, and one steal. The game also gets bonus points for being the last Christmas game for the Jazz before the move to Utah.

Pistol Pete Maravich scored 3,667 points in 83 games over 3 years at LSU.

If you took the nation's top 83 single-game scoring performances in the last 3 years(not including this season)you'd have a combined 3,465 total points pic.twitter.com/By7PJ7WoPh

‚Äî BaseballHistoryNut (@nut_history) December 4, 2025

For it being the first Christmas Day game, one would think this game would be ranked higher. However, the games to come stand out 

The Jazz had a record of 11-18, though it didn‚Äôt stop them from punching above their weight. What the game lacked in story points, it earned in style points ‚Äì the game was a slugfest between the two teams.

The Jazz controlled the first half of the game, then the Rockets stormed back to take the lead in the third quarter. Magic happened in the fourth, and the Jazz squeaked by to secure the two-point win over the Rockets. Any game ending with a winning shot is worth watching. Sadly, there was no found footage of the game.

The leading scorer for the Jazz was Louie Nelson with 21 points, seven rebounds, and two assists. Maravich scored 19 points and added four assists to the cause.

The fifth pick barely passed the sixth pick by being the Jazz‚Äôs first Christmas win in the twenty-first century. The year 2018 marked a new beginning for the Jazz as Gordon Hayward left for Boston and Donovan Mitchell became Utah‚Äôs new star.

On Dec 25, 2018, the league decided to give this exciting young Jazz core a chance on Santa‚Äôs big day. They were paired with a Portland Trail Blazers team, looking to prove their dominance.

Style points for this game were quite low. The first half was quite close, with Damian Lillard putting the Blazers on his back. He ended up with a stat line of 20 points, four assists, and five rebounds.

Once the Jazz got control of the game in the second half, they didn‚Äôt look back. However, player contributions were quite huge.

Defensive beast Rudy Gobert had 18 points, 14 rebounds, and seven blocks. He was aided by Mitchell‚Äôs 19 points, two assists, and two rebounds. Even NBA legend Joe Ingles contributed 15 points to the Jazz‚Äôs win. Any game with Ingles deserves to be higher on the list.

This next game had both Jazz and LA Lakers greats going toe-to-toe with each other. Even though it was a blowout victory, the Jazz beating the Lakers alone makes this game legendary.

The game was a precursor to an amazing Western Conference Semifinals series between the two bruisers that same year. Magic Johnson had a good game of 18 points, 10 assists, three steals, and five rebounds.

Karl Malone showed the league he was Him with 31 points, two steals, and 12 rebounds. Current Jazz color analyst Thurl Bailey added 22 points and seven rebounds off the bench.

Not only did fans see great individual performances, but they also got to see a shoving match between Malone and Johnson. This further added to this game‚Äôs repertoire.

Played on Christmas Day 1979, the third spot is a story full of triumph and heartbreak.

The Jazz won pretty handily against their Rocky Mountain neighbors, the Denver Nuggets. How they did it was quite phenomenal.¬†It was a tight game through the second and third quarters. With the game on the line, the Jazz had two heroes emerge to lead them to victory.

The first player was Jazz all-timer Adrian Dantley, who came in to score 27 points and four assists. The second player to make his impact was a little-known shooting guard named Terry Furlow, who ended up scoring 37 points, five assists, and two rebounds. It was the best game of Furlow‚Äôs career.

Unfortunately, that wasn‚Äôt the biggest impact he made on the league. In the waking hours of May 23, 1980, after partying, Furlow crashed into a utility pole, killing him on impact. Drugs were found in his system.

Lakers legend Johnson was a pallbearer at his funeral ‚Äì a stark reminder of how fragile life is and how important the holidays are to see family members and friends.

At Terry Furlow‚Äôs funeral, stars like @MagicJohnson, Campy Russell, Greg Kelser, and George McGinnis were some of the pallbearers at New Jerusalem Church in Flint. See this vintage @flintjournal photo. He was truly one of the greats.

‚Äî Eric Woodyard (@E_Woodyard) January 2, 2018

The second-best game was set at the height of the Jazz renaissance in the early 2020s.

The Jazz were set to face the Dallas Mavericks on Dec 25, 2021. Having their best record in years, the three-seeded Jazz were looking to show the league who they were. The Mavericks, on the other hand, were full of a young core trying to prove themselves.

The game was like two heavyweights dealing blows. The Mavericks would control the game, then the Jazz would make a run. Mitchell had a heyday even while being hampered by an injury, scoring 33 points, three assists, and three steals.

Kristaps Porzingis and Jalen Brunson feasted on smaller defenders, scoring a combined 54 points. It took a combined effort from Mitchell, the Flamethrower Jordan Clarkson, and the rest of the starting core to win in the fourth quarter.

Out of all of the games, this was one of the most entertaining, with both teams having trouble keeping a lead. It also had great performances from individual players.

It was tough to decide between the number one and number two picks. Both were great games and featured great performances. However, number one was a better game with Jazz greats playing to their fullest. Much like pick two, the number one game was a back-and-forth conundrum.

Both the Jazz and Rockets were getting a piece of each other in the early half of the season.¬†On Christmas Day, 1997, fans got to see a preview of an iconic playoff series. It wasn‚Äôt until the third quarter that the Jazz managed to keep a small lead.

John Stockton robbed the world of a Chicago Bulls and Houston Rockets NBA Finals.

Jordan, Pippen, Rodman vs. Olajuwon, Drexler, Barkley would‚Äôve been must see TV and the Rockets owned the Bulls back then.

Rockets in 6 https://t.co/AEzZxM47rH pic.twitter.com/5ifMVJeO8I

‚Äî VÃ∑aÃ∑tÃ∑oÃ∑rÃ∑ (@VatorSports) May 28, 2023

The Rockets weren‚Äôt done and ended up coming back to tie the Jazz 101-101 in the fourth quarter. John Stockton took over and scored four major points to put the team ahead. Kevin Willis answered back with a tip-shot to put the Rockets within striking distance. Bryon Russell struggled off the bench but drew a foul to shoot two free throws to ice the game.

Stockton scored 24 points and tallied three assists, while Malone added 20 points, 10 rebounds and six assists. Jeff Hornacek made a huge contribution as well with 20 points and nine assists.

Not only did Stockton, Malone, and Hornacek outduel the likes of Charles Barkley, Clyde Drexler, and Willis, but it was a glimpse of a great Western Conference finals matchup, showing why this game is worthy of the number one pick.

The post What is the Best Christmas Day Game in Jazz History? appeared first on The Lead.

title: Three-time MVP Jokic suffers 'gut-wrenching' injury
description: Three-time NBA MVP Nikola Jokic suffers a "gut-wrenching" knee injury as the Denver Nuggets lose 147-123 at the Miami Heat.
fullText:
Three-time NBA Most Valuable Player Nikola Jokic suffered a "gut-wrenching" knee injury as the Denver Nuggets lost 147-123 at the Miami Heat.

Jokic was hurt late in the first half in an accidental coming together with team-mate Spencer Jones.

Jones stepped on the foot of Jokic who immediately collapsed to the ground clutching his knee.

The 30-year-old will have an MRI scan on Tuesday to determine the seriousness of the problem.

"Immediately, he knew something was wrong," said Nuggets head coach David Adelman.

"This is part of the NBA. Anyone who gets hurt, it's gut-wrenching, especially somebody as special as he is. We'll find out more tomorrow.

"We'll move on as a team. Obviously, right now, I'm more concerned just about him as a person and the disappointment of going through something like that."

Jokic, who leads the NBA season in rebounds and assists, had 21 points and eight assists in the game before suffering the injury.

title: 2026 NBA Championship Odds: Thunder Still Making Noise Heading into New Year
description: The latest 2026 NBA Championship odds and analysis, with the Oklahoma City Thunder (+135) drawing the shortest odds to win it all.
fullText:
It's amazing what a 27-5 start can do for the perception of a team.

The conversation around the Oklahoma City Thunder has shifted over the past few weeks from whether OKC is the best team in the NBA to whether they may just be the best team of all time.

There's no arguing the fact that the Thunder's 14.2 net rating is the best in modern history, and the defending champs have as much skill, depth, and defensive grit as any dynastic team in recent memory. It's no wonder then that their +135 odds to win the NBA Championship are far and away the shortest in the Association.

Let's dive into the latest odds as the Thunder continue to separate themselves from the rest of the pack.

Here's a visual representation of how the NBA championship has odds evolved since June 2025.

We turned to the enormous computing power of ChatGPT to find out who the large language model believes will be the last team standing this season. Not surprisingly, it stuck with the defending champs.

Oklahoma City has the cleanest runway to be the best team in 2026: an MVP-caliber engine in Shai Gilgeous-Alexander entering the heart of his prime, a two-way star wing in Jalen Williams, and a 7-footer in Chet Holmgren whose blend of rim protection, spacing, and feel supercharges modern schemes. That trio already drives elite half-court efficiency and a top-tier defense, and it‚Äôs backed by organizational continuity that reliably turns role players into playoff-useful pieces. By 2026, Holmgren‚Äôs strength and timing should be fully NBA-hardened, unlocking more switching and fewer help-and-recover compromises, while SGA‚Äôs mid-range and foul-drawing remain matchup-proof in May and June.

Depth and optionality push the Thunder over the top. They can win big or small, play five-out without sacrificing rim protection, and toggle between pressure defense and conservative coverages depending on opponent. Crucially, they still have surplus picks and cap flexibility to plug the inevitable holes that show up in a long postseason, whether that‚Äôs a second unit scorer, another stretch big, or a specialist wing.

Expect a rotation stacked with plus length, shooting, and decision-making around the core; enough to outlast the West‚Äôs heavyweights and finish the job in the Finals.

title: Westbrook passes Magic Johnson for 7th place in career assists as Kings beat Mavericks 113-107
description: Russell Westbrook scored 21 points and moved past Magic Johnson for seventh place on the NBA‚Äôs career assists list while leading the Sacramento Kings to a 113-107 win over the Dallas Mavericks on Saturday.  Westbrook grabbed five rebounds, and his nine assists gave him 10,149 ‚Äî eight more than Johnson.  The 37-year-old Westbroook also moved within nine points of tying Dominique Wilkins for 19th on the NBA‚Äôs scoring chart while propelling Sacramento to its third victory in 13 games.
fullText:
SACRAMENTO, Calif. (AP) ‚Äî Russell Westbrook scored 21 points and moved past Magic Johnson for seventh place on the NBA‚Äôs career assists list while leading the Sacramento Kings to a 113-107 win over the Dallas Mavericks on Saturday.

Westbrook grabbed five rebounds, and his nine assists gave him 10,149 ‚Äî eight more than Johnson.

The 37-year-old Westbroook also moved within nine points of tying Dominique Wilkins for 19th on the NBA‚Äôs scoring chart while propelling Sacramento to its third victory in 13 games.

Dallas got within 111-107 with nine seconds remaining before DeMar DeRozan made two free throws to seal it.

Keon Ellis hit five 3-pointers and had 21 points, Maxime Raynaud added 19 points and Dennis Schroder scored 10. Rookie guard Nique Clifford had eight points and nine rebounds off the bench to help the Kings (8-23) to their fourth consecutive win over the Mavericks.

Cooper Flagg had 23 points, six rebounds and five assists but also committed five turnovers for Dallas (12-21). P.J. Washington had 17 points and four blocks, and Klay Thompson scored 14 points.

The Mavs have lost four of five.

After blowing much of an 18-point lead, Sacramento made four 3-pointers as part of a 20-10 run in the third quarter. Ellis drained two 3s and scored eight points as part of the surge.

The Kings are 35-48 under coach Doug Christie, who took over initially on an interim basis when Mike Brown was fired last December.

Ellis got the Kings going early with 13 points in the first quarter to help Sacramento to a double-digit lead.

Dallas trimmed the margin to eight but the Kings doubled that midway through the second quarter and led 59-44 at halftime.

Mavericks: Visit the Portland Trail Blazers on Monday night.

Kings: Play the Lakers in Los Angeles on Sunday.

title: Hornets coach Charles Lee is excited about Tidjane Salaun's recent development
description: Tidjane Salaun has largely struggled during his NBA career, but he has shown promise for the Hornets recently.
fullText:
Hornets coach Charles Lee is excited about Tidjane Salaun's recent development originally appeared on The Sporting News. Add The Sporting News as a Preferred Source by clicking here.

Tidjane Salaun has not been the most popular player on the Charlotte Hornets roster since he was selected sixth overall in the 2024 NBA Draft. Considering he was chosen with such a high pick, many people expected him to be a star-level talent.

Unfortunately for the Hornets and their fans, Salaun might not pan out as the star player they were expecting. However, he is working hard to become a productive contributor to Charles Lee's system with the Hornets.

Considering Salaun is only in his second NBA season, he has a lot of room to grow. He is only 20, so his development is still pending. Most players' development is not linear, so these recent performances might be a good sign for the Hornets moving forward.

Coach Lee would love to see Salaun further improve because he is a big believer in the 20-year-old Frenchman. After an underwhelming rookie year, Salaun is playing fewer minutes this season, but he has been more efficient.

More:¬†Hornets' Kon Knueppel ruled out against Magic with ankle injury

The 20-year-old is averaging 7.1 points on 51.1% from the field and 45.7% from three. Salaun has accepted his role, and he is doing his best to be as productive as possible. Coach Lee is pleased to see this because he sees solid potential with Salaun.

"He's totally embraced his role. He just realizes how much he can impact the game on both ends of the floor without just scoring, and that's what we're seeing.¬†We're seeing more of a well-rounded game from him, where he's rebounding defensively and guarding multiple different guys," Lee said after winning on Friday.

"Offensively, that play where he had an opportunity to shoot an off-the-dribble step-back three, which he has in the past, and to make the one-more pass was very encouraging to see. It just shows how much he's about team, trying to compete, and do everything he can to impact winning."

Against the Orlando Magic, Salaun had a superb game, posting 14 points on 6-7 shooting from the field while grabbing nine rebounds. It was an impressive performance that could lead to some consistency in the long run.

As long as Salaun is playing this way, one can expect that the Hornets will have a reliable wing moving forward. It will be a lengthy journey, but Salaun is only 20, so he has plenty of time to develop.

Trades are coming in Los Angeles. Just a matter of who and when. Without them, this team has no chance of winning a title this year. That much is obvious after watching the Lakers as of late and listening to what JJ Redick said postgame.

title: Ex-NBA Champion Takes Aim at Luka Doncic After Lakers' Loss vs Rockets
description: Luka Doncic and the LA Lakers came up short against the Houston Rockets. The former NBA Champion, Kendrick Perkins, got critical of the star for his shortcomings.
fullText:
Ex-NBA Champion Takes Aim at Luka Doncic After Lakers' Loss vs Rockets originally appeared on The Sporting News. Add The Sporting News as a Preferred Source by clicking here.

The Los Angeles Lakers‚Äô losing streak continued with an NBA Christmas Day slate loss against the Houston Rockets.

With an opportunity to prove they are one of the top contenders in the Western Conference on the primetime stage, the Lakers fell flat. Shortly after the game wrapped up, the outspoken former NBA veteran Kendrick Perkins offered the Lakers a piece of his mind.

‚ÄúAgain, the Rockets exposed what we already knew that the Lakers are horrible defensively and it starts with Luka,‚Äù Perkins wrote on social media.

‚ÄúHe gave no effort defensively tonight and went back to his old ways of complaining to the officials all damn game.‚Äù

Again the Rockets exposed what we already knew that the Lakers are horrible defensively and it starts with Luka. He gave no effort defensively tonight and went back to his old ways of complaining to the officials all damn game.

‚Äî Kendrick Perkins (@KendrickPerkins) December 26, 2025

Doncic checked in for 34 minutes of action on Thursday night. He went 9-17 from the field and attempted seven shots from the charity stripe. Doncic scored a game-high of 25 points, while coming down with five rebounds, and producing seven assists.

He also turned the ball over six times, more than any other player involved, and finished the game as a minus-25.

The Lakers were blown out with a score of 119-96. With that loss, they dropped to three straight defeats. Now, the Lakers are 19-10 on the year, slipping to fifth in the Western Conference standings. The victory for Houston allowed the Rockets to pull within half a game of the Lakers.

Doncic and the Lakers aren‚Äôt in panic mode, but it‚Äôs clear that the coaching staff is growing frustrated with the team‚Äôs lack of execution, especially on the defensive end. It‚Äôs something that JJ Redick shined a light on earlier this week after the Lakers lost to the Phoenix Suns.

On Thursday night, Redick surely didn‚Äôt hold back. After Doncic and the Lakers get a day off on Friday, they‚Äôll be back on the practice court for what Redick describes as an ‚Äúuncomfortable‚Äù practice and film session. The Lakers will get a chance to bounce back against the struggling Sacramento Kings on Sunday.

Between the public pressure from analysts such as Perkins‚Äîand the brutally honest assessment from Redick‚ÄîDoncic and the Lakers have a lot riding on them over the next couple of days. A comfortable win over the Kings could help them get back on the right track. Soon, the hoops world will see how the Lakers respond.

title: NBA Insider reunites Klay Thompson with Warriors in proposed deal
description: The hypothetical eight-team trade would send Jonathan Kuminga to the Jazz.
fullText:
NBA Insider reunites Klay Thompson with Warriors in proposed deal originally appeared on The Sporting News. Add The Sporting News as a Preferred Source by clicking here.

The future status of Golden State Warriors forward Jonathan Kuminga remains one of the most fascinating in the NBA, and trade talks involving him are growing louder.

Bleacher Report's Eric Pincus proposed an eight-team deal that would send Kuminga elsewhere and reunite Klay Thompson with the Warriors. The full trade involves the Warriors, Jazz, Mavericks, Magic, Nets, Nuggets, Raptors and Suns.

Golden State would receive Thompson, Jonathan Isaac, Day'Ron Sharpe, Garrett Temple and a Jazz 2027 first-round pick. Kuminga would head to Utah, along with Hunter Tyson (Nuggets) and Nigel Hayes-Davis (Suns). Buddy Hield, Al Horford and Trayce Jackson-Davis would also be moved from the Warriors in the deal.

"The Warriors satisfy Curry's wishes, getting Thompson to replace Hield, who has struggled to hit shots this season," Pincus said. "The trio (with Draymond Green) would be on the path to close their historic runs together through the 2026-27 season, provided Green opts into the final year of his contract."

MORE:¬†Ben Simmons is going pro in a sport you'd never expect

Thompson would return to Golden State, where he spent 13 seasons before being traded to Dallas in the 2024 offseason. Kuminga, who's seen a diminished role with the Warriors this season, would get a fresh start.

"Perhaps more importantly, the team gains necessary closure on the drawn-out Jonathan Kuminga saga, which left him a restricted free agent for most of the summer and currently has the 23-year-old forward out of coach Steve Kerr's rotation."

The eight-team deal would be the largest trade in NBA history, passing the Houston Rockets' trade for Kevin Durant last summer.
